text: all right today I'm doing my version of
lentil soup I like to do it with a
braised ham hock really flavors the
stock nicely in just a rich delicious
winter soup so you're going to get one
pork smoked ham hock
alright that's basically the high in a
shank of a pig the lower lower ankle
there and it takes a long time to braise
but it's totally worth a very delicious
flavor we're going to simmer it in some
stock I'm going to go one quart of
chicken stock and one quart of beef
broth so what you can do two quarts of
any kind of liquid basically but I'm
going to use half chicken half beef here
so it's two quarts all together alright
we're going to bring that up to a simmer
I'm going to add some black pepper and a
little bit of cayenne to taste those
about a half a teaspoon you're going to
adjust all this stuff later of course
with any soup one bay leaf and I think
dry thyme is really nice with any kind
of bean soup or lentil so I'm going to
go with some dry thyme any kind of dried
herbs probably going to work here
whatever your favorites I'm not adding
salt ok that smoked ham hock could be
salty I don't know yet if I want to
taste later put the lid on and simmer
that on low for one hour and thirty
minutes see new improved graphics one
hour 30 minutes and in that hour and
thirty minutes while the hock still is
not tender but it's starting to get
there the meat is starting to pull away

though so it's going to need to cook for
quite a while longer but at this point
we're going to add add our mirepoix now
pardon my french but as you well know

about 2 cups of onion a cup of carrot

doesn't have to be exact its soup forgot

the vegetables are pretty much cooked

all right now we're going to add our

what a great soup so easy
I know it's convenient you open that can
of lentil soup but it's a great excuse
